availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Breckinridge County, Kentucky farmer. Kentucky native. Married Mary Mattingly. Father of Felix F. Mattingly. Held one slave in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, District 2, p. 52. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, Hardinsburg, p. 178. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, Cloverport, p. 32. “Charles Clifton Mattingly (1811-1874),” Find A Grave, memorial no. 49017335, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=49017335&ref=acom (accessed June 26, 2017).
